meta.title: CryptoRefund | Professional Crypto Asset Recovery
meta.description: Professional cryptocurrency recovery services. We help victims of crypto fraud, exchange issues, and unauthorized transactions recover their assets.

hero.title: Secure
hero.description: As the world's leading cryptocurrency platform in licensing, registration, and security certification, our commitment to clients is built on trust. We ensure data security, asset protection, and transparent refund procedures.

services.title: Comprehensive
services.subtitle: We specialize in recovering funds from various types of cryptocurrency fraud and platform issues.

exchange.title: Exchange Recovery
exchange.description: Lost access to your exchange account? Funds frozen or locked? We work with exchanges and regulators to restore your access and recover your assets.

scam.title: Scam Recovery
scam.description: Fallen victim to a crypto scam? Our team traces transactions, identifies perpetrators, and works to recover your stolen funds through legal channels.

forex.title: Forex & Exchange Recovery
forex.description: Victim of forex fraud or trapped funds in a collapsed exchange? We recover assets from unregulated brokers and navigate bankruptcy proceedings.

broker.title: Broker Recovery
broker.description: Lost money to an unlicensed broker? Our team traces funds and works with regulators to recover assets from fraudulent brokerage schemes.

howItWorks.title: How
howItWorks.subtitle: Our proven 4-step process maximizes your chances of successful recovery.

step1.title: Free Consultation
step1.description: Share your case details with us. We'll evaluate your situation and explain your options at no cost.

step2.title: Case Analysis
step2.description: Our experts analyze transactions, trace funds, and build a comprehensive recovery strategy.

step3.title: Recovery Action
step3.description: We initiate recovery through exchanges, legal channels, and regulatory bodies worldwide.

step4.title: Funds Returned
step4.description: Recovered assets are transferred directly to your wallet. You only pay on success.

cases.title: Real
cases.subtitle: Detailed examples of how we've helped clients recover their assets.

case1.title: Binance Account Unlocked After Wrongful Suspension
case1.p1: A German client had their Binance account frozen with €312,000 in assets after a routine security review flagged legitimate transactions as suspicious. Despite multiple appeals, the exchange refused to unlock the funds.
case1.p2: Our team prepared comprehensive documentation proving the legitimate source of funds, coordinated with Binance's compliance department through our industry contacts, and filed regulatory complaints with BaFin. The account was fully restored with all assets intact.

case2.title: Fake Trading Platform – Funds Traced and Recovered
case2.p1: A UK investor deposited £98,000 into what appeared to be a legitimate trading platform. After initial "profits," all withdrawal requests were denied. The platform eventually went offline.
case2.p2: Using blockchain analysis, we traced the stolen funds through 23 wallets to a centralized exchange. We worked with law enforcement to freeze the assets and filed legal proceedings in Cyprus where the scammers operated. 85% of the original investment was recovered.

case3.title: KuCoin Bonus Lock – Terms Dispute Resolution
case3.p1: An Austrian trader's €78,000 balance was locked due to a bonus he didn't realize he accepted. The exchange demanded 50x trading volume before any withdrawal – an impossible €3.9 million in trades.
case3.p2: We negotiated directly with KuCoin's legal team, demonstrating that the bonus terms weren't clearly disclosed. After presenting evidence of misleading UI practices, the exchange agreed to forfeit the bonus and release the original deposit in full.

case4.title: Cyprus Forex Broker – Unlicensed Platform Shutdown
case4.p1: A French investor lost €215,000 to an unlicensed forex broker operating from Cyprus. The platform manipulated trades and refused all withdrawal requests, claiming "bonus conditions" weren't met.
case4.p2: We filed complaints with CySEC and coordinated with Cypriot authorities. Our legal team initiated civil proceedings and traced company assets. The broker's accounts were frozen and funds were recovered through court-ordered restitution.

case5.title: Romance Scam OKX – Emotional Manipulation Recovery
case5.p1: A Dutch victim was manipulated through a dating app into investing €89,000 in what they believed was a legitimate crypto opportunity. The scammer used fake OKX interfaces to simulate trading gains.
case5.p2: Our forensic team traced the funds through multiple wallets to an exchange where the scammer attempted to cash out. Working with OKX's fraud department and Dutch law enforcement, we froze the funds and initiated recovery proceedings.

case6.title: FTX Bankruptcy – Creditor Claims Navigation
case6.p1: A Swiss client had €156,000 trapped in FTX when the exchange collapsed. Navigating the complex bankruptcy proceedings seemed impossible without specialized legal knowledge.
case6.p2: Our team filed priority creditor claims, gathered all necessary documentation, and worked with the bankruptcy trustees. We successfully advocated for our client's position in the creditor hierarchy, securing a significantly higher recovery rate than average creditors.

certificates.title: Our
certificates.subtitle: Recognized excellence in cryptocurrency recovery services.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our recovery services.

q1.question: How do I know if my case is recoverable?
q1.answer: Every case is unique. We offer free consultations to evaluate your situation. Factors include the type of fraud, time elapsed, amount involved, and available documentation. Our success rate is 94% for cases we accept.

q2.question: How long does the recovery process take?
q2.answer: Recovery timelines vary based on complexity. Simple exchange issues may resolve in 2-4 weeks, while complex fraud cases can take 2-6 months. We keep you informed throughout the entire process.

q3.question: What are your fees?
q3.answer: We operate on a "No Win, No Fee" basis. You only pay a success fee when we recover your funds. The initial consultation is completely free. Fee percentages are discussed transparently before we begin.

q4.question: What documents do I need?
q4.answer: Typically we need: transaction records, communication with the platform/scammer, wallet addresses involved, any contracts or agreements, and proof of identity. We'll guide you through exactly what's needed for your case.

q5.question: Do you work internationally?
q5.answer: Yes, we operate globally. Our team has experience working with exchanges, regulators, and legal systems across Europe, North America, Asia, and beyond. Cryptocurrency fraud is borderless, and so is our recovery capability.

footer.description: Professional cryptocurrency recovery services. We help victims of crypto fraud and platform issues recover their digital assets through legal channels.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.p1: This personal data processing policy has been prepared in accordance with the requirements of the European Union law dated 25.05.2018 No. 679 "General Data Protection Regulation" (GDPR) and defines the procedure for processing personal data and measures for their protection.
section1.p2: 1.1. The Operator's primary goal is to respect human rights and freedoms when processing their personal data.
section1.p3: 1.2. This Policy applies to all information that the Operator receives about service users.

section2.title: 2. Basic Concepts
section2.item1: 2.1. Automated processing – processing using computing technology.
section2.item2: 2.2. Data blocking – temporary suspension of processing.
section2.item3: 2.3. Service – a set of functional capabilities.
section2.item5: 2.5. Personal data – any information about the user.
section2.item6: 2.6. User – any person using the service.
section2.item7: 2.7. Data provision – disclosure to a specific person.
section2.item8: 2.8. Data distribution – disclosure to an indefinite circle of persons.

section3.title: 3. Rights and Obligations of the Operator
section3.rights: 3.1. The Operator has the right to:
section3.right2: process data without consent in cases provided by law;
section3.obligation2: process data in accordance with GDPR;
section3.obligation5: cease processing upon achieving goals or upon request.

section4.title: 4. Rights and Obligations of Users
section4.right2: request clarification or deletion of data;
section4.right3: give and withdraw consent to processing;
section4.obligation: 4.2. Users are obliged to provide accurate data and notify of any changes.

section5.title: 5. What Data is Processed
section5.item3: Special categories of data are not processed, except in cases permitted by GDPR.

section6.title: 6. Data Processing Principles
section6.item2: Data is collected for specific purposes.
section6.item4: Storage until goals are achieved, after which data is deleted or anonymized.

section7.title: 7. Purposes of Data Processing
section7.item3: Providing access to services and materials.

section9.title: 9. Conditions of Data Processing
section9.p1: Processing is carried out with user consent or in cases provided by GDPR.
section9.p2: Data may be processed for contract performance, obligations, or protection of interests.

section10.title: 10. Procedure for Collection, Storage and Transfer of Data
section10.item1: Security is ensured and third-party access is excluded.
section10.item2: Data is not transferred without user consent, except in cases required by law.
section10.item3: The user can update data and withdraw consent.
section10.item4: Storage until goals are achieved or consent is withdrawn.

section11.title: 11. Operator Actions with Data
section11.p1: Collection, recording, systematization, storage, use, transfer, anonymization, blocking, deletion and destruction of data.

section12.title: 12. Cross-Border Data Transfer
section12.p1: Transfer outside the country only in compliance with rights protection or with user consent.

section13.title: 13. Confidentiality
section13.p1: The Operator and persons with access are obliged not to disclose data without user consent, unless otherwise provided by law.

section14.title: 14. Final Provisions
section14.p1: 14.1. The user can receive clarifications on data processing issues.
section14.p2: 14.2. This Policy is effective indefinitely and is published publicly.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.p1: These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your use of the CryptoRefund website and services ("Service"). By using our Service, you agree to these Terms.
section1.p2: 1.1. CryptoRefund provides cryptocurrency recovery consulting and assistance services.
section1.p3: 1.2. These Terms constitute a legally binding agreement between you and CryptoRefund.

section2.title: 2. Service Description
section2.p1: 2.1. We provide consulting services to help victims of cryptocurrency fraud and platform issues.
section2.p2: 2.2. Our services include: case evaluation, blockchain analysis, communication with exchanges and regulators, and legal assistance coordination.
section2.p3: 2.3. We do not guarantee the recovery of funds. Success depends on many factors including the nature of the case, available documentation, and cooperation of third parties.

section3.title: 3. User Obligations
section3.item1: Provide accurate and complete information about your case.
section3.item2: Supply all requested documentation in a timely manner.
section3.item3: Not provide false or misleading information.
section3.item4: Cooperate fully with our team throughout the recovery process.
section3.item5: Keep confidential any proprietary methods or information shared by us.

section4.title: 4. Fees and Payment
section4.p1: 4.1. Initial consultation is provided free of charge.
section4.p2: 4.2. We operate on a "No Win, No Fee" basis for most cases. You only pay a success fee when we recover your funds.
section4.p3: 4.3. Fee percentages and payment terms are discussed and agreed upon before we begin work on your case.
section4.p4: 4.4. All fees and costs will be clearly outlined in a written agreement.

section5.title: 5. Limitation of Liability
section5.p1: 5.1. CryptoRefund provides services on an "as is" basis without warranties of any kind.
section5.p2: 5.2. We are not liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use of our services.
section5.p3: 5.3. Our total liability shall not exceed the fees paid by you for our services.

section6.title: 6. Confidentiality
section6.p1: 6.1. We treat all client information as strictly confidential.
section6.p2: 6.2. We will not disclose your information to third parties without your consent, except as required by law or necessary for the recovery process.
section6.p3: 6.3. Our data handling practices are detailed in our Privacy Policy.

section7.title: 7. Intellectual Property
section7.p1: 7.1. All content on this website, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is the property of CryptoRefund.
section7.p2: 7.2. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our written permission.

section8.title: 8. Termination
section8.p1: 8.1. Either party may terminate the service agreement with written notice.
section8.p2: 8.2. Upon termination, any fees owed for work completed will become due.

section9.title: 9. Dispute Resolution
section9.p1: 9.1. Any disputes shall first be attempted to be resolved through good-faith negotiation.
section9.p2: 9.2. If negotiation fails, disputes shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with EU regulations.
section9.p3: 9.3. These Terms are governed by the laws of the European Union.

section10.title: 10. Changes to Terms
section10.p1: 10.1. We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time.
section10.p2: 10.2. Changes will be effective upon posting to our website.
section10.p3: 10.3. Continued use of our Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.

section11.title: 11. Contact Information
section11.p1: For questions about these Terms, please contact us through our website or consultation form.
